intro: Vicia sativa var. aristulata, commonly known as the tufted vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant produces small, elongated pods containing several seeds, which are typically dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Vicia sativa var. aristulata is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, making it beneficial in soil enrichment.
